title: In fuel-guzzling Saudi Arabia, electric cars pique interest
content: For Hamed al-Rafidain, a Saudi human resources worker, an electric vehicle offers welcome savings, especially since his other car is a fuel-guzzling four-wheeler favoured by motorists in the desert kingdom. "What drove me to buy an electric vehicle was financial considerations," said Rafidain, who spends up to 2,000 riyals ($530) a month on fuel for his off-road vehicle.
summary: For Hamed al-Rafidain, a Saudi human resources worker, an electric vehicle offers welcome savings, especially since his other car is a fuel-guzzling four-wheeler favoured by motorists in the desert kingdom. "What drove me to buy an electric vehicle was financial considerations," said Rafidain, who spends up to 2,000 riyals ($530) a month on fuel for his off-road vehicle.

title: 'Jimmy Carter passed away' turns out to be social 'experiment': Fake news alert
'A choice between freedom and chaos': US presidential candidate Kamala Harris rallies voters in Milwaukee
content: Vice President Kamala Harris launched her campaign rally in Milwaukee, attacking former President Trump and framing the election as a choice between 'freedom and chaos.' Bolstered by $100 million in donations and endorsements from key Democrats, Harris emphasised her prosecutorial background and commitment to a 'people first' campaign. Trump's campaign quickly labelled her 'Lyin' Kamala Harris, while Republican leaders dismissed her as an 'extreme liberal.'
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris launched her campaign rally in Milwaukee, attacking former President Trump and framing the election as a choice between 'freedom and chaos.' Bolstered by $100 million in donations and endorsements from key Democrats, Harris emphasised her prosecutorial background and commitment to a 'people first' campaign. Trump's campaign quickly labelled her 'Lyin' Kamala Harris, while Republican leaders dismissed her as an 'extreme liberal.'

title: 'Like finding an oasis in desert ...': Nasa's Curiosity rover stuns scientists with discovery of pure sulphur on Mars
content: Nasa's Curiosity rover has made a groundbreaking find on Mars, discovering pure sulphur in rocks after driving over and cracking them open. This unexpected discovery, made on May 30 in the Gediz Vallis channel, intrigues scientists and prompts a reevaluation of Mars' geological history and potential for life. The find marks a rare event in planetary exploration.
summary: Nasa's Curiosity rover has made a groundbreaking find on Mars, discovering pure sulphur in rocks after driving over and cracking them open. This unexpected discovery, made on May 30 in the Gediz Vallis channel, intrigues scientists and prompts a reevaluation of Mars' geological history and potential for life. The find marks a rare event in planetary exploration.

title: High-profile divorce in Dubai's royal family: Who is Sheikha Mahra's ex-husband Sheikh Mana?
content: Sheikha Mahra Bint Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum, daughter of Dubai’s ruler, announced her divorce from Sheikh Mana Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Bin Mana Al Maktoum via Instagram on July 16, accusing him of infidelity and invoking 'triple talaq'. The couple had welcomed their first child earlier this year. Sheikh Mana, a 25-year-old entrepreneur, is known for his royal connections and adventurous lifestyle.
summary: Sheikha Mahra Bint Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum, daughter of Dubai’s ruler, announced her divorce from Sheikh Mana Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Bin Mana Al Maktoum via Instagram on July 16, accusing him of infidelity and invoking 'triple talaq'. The couple had welcomed their first child earlier this year. Sheikh Mana, a 25-year-old entrepreneur, is known for his royal connections and adventurous lifestyle.

title: Kamala Harris may urge Israeli PM Netanyahu to end war in Gaza during his White House visit
content: Kamala Harris planned to ask Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu to end the Israel-Hamas conflict during his visit to the White House, highlighting security for Israel and dignity for Palestinians. Her absence from Netanyahu's Congress address drew criticism due to her prior commitments.
summary: Kamala Harris planned to ask Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu to end the Israel-Hamas conflict during his visit to the White House, highlighting security for Israel and dignity for Palestinians. Her absence from Netanyahu's Congress address drew criticism due to her prior commitments.

title: Typhoon Gaemi floods Manila with knee-deep water, 16 flights cancelled
content: Typhoon Gaemi and the southwest monsoon have caused severe flooding across Manila and Luzon Island, with knee-deep water in several areas. The storm has led to 16 flight cancellations, the suspension of government offices and classes, and widespread road closures. A 14-year-old boy is missing, and Gaemi is expected to continue bringing heavy rain until Thursday.
summary: Typhoon Gaemi and the southwest monsoon have caused severe flooding across Manila and Luzon Island, with knee-deep water in several areas. The storm has led to 16 flight cancellations, the suspension of government offices and classes, and widespread road closures. A 14-year-old boy is missing, and Gaemi is expected to continue bringing heavy rain until Thursday.

title: Labour party MPs suspended after voting against two-child benefit cap
content: Seven Labour MPs, including John McDonnell, have been suspended for six months after voting against the government on an amendment to scrap the two-child benefit cap. The cap, which prevents parents from claiming Universal Credit or child tax credit for more than two children, remains a contentious issue, with suspended MPs advocating for its removal to alleviate child poverty.
summary: Seven Labour MPs, including John McDonnell, have been suspended for six months after voting against the government on an amendment to scrap the two-child benefit cap. The cap, which prevents parents from claiming Universal Credit or child tax credit for more than two children, remains a contentious issue, with suspended MPs advocating for its removal to alleviate child poverty.

title: North Korea does ‘not care’ About Trump’s words for Kim
content: North Korea’s state media dismissed former President Donald Trump's claims of having good ties with leader Kim Jong Un, stating “we do not care” and emphasizing that its nuclear arsenal is prepared for any US leader. The Korean Central News Agency commented that while Trump attempted to foster personal relations, North Korea viewed US policy as consistently hostile.
summary: North Korea’s state media dismissed former President Donald Trump's claims of having good ties with leader Kim Jong Un, stating “we do not care” and emphasizing that its nuclear arsenal is prepared for any US leader. The Korean Central News Agency commented that while Trump attempted to foster personal relations, North Korea viewed US policy as consistently hostile.

title: Australian woman gang raped in Paris ahead of 2024 Olympics
content: ​​The 25-year-old woman sought shelter in a kebab shop located in the Pigalle district on July 20 morning, with her dress partially torn, a CCTV footage shows.

title: Watch: 'Pissed off' whales topple boat, fishermen into sea in US
Sudan's RSF agrees to US-backed 'cease-fire' talks
content: Sudanese RSF leader welcomes upcoming US-backed cease-fire talks aimed at ending the civil war. UN documents grave human rights violations including killings, sexual violence, and use of child soldiers. Conflict has uprooted millions and sparked famine fears.
summary: Sudanese RSF leader welcomes upcoming US-backed cease-fire talks aimed at ending the civil war. UN documents grave human rights violations including killings, sexual violence, and use of child soldiers. Conflict has uprooted millions and sparked famine fears.

Donald Trump to host Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida
content: Netanyahu had reportedly requested an in-person meeting with Trump during his visit to Washington this week. The Israeli leader is set to address US Congress on Wednesday, seeking renewed support for Israel's military operations in the Palestinian enclave.
summary: Netanyahu had reportedly requested an in-person meeting with Trump during his visit to Washington this week. The Israeli leader is set to address US Congress on Wednesday, seeking renewed support for Israel's military operations in the Palestinian enclave.

title: Heatwave fatalities rise in US: Hiker dies from heat and dehydration in Utah
content: A 56-year-old woman died from high temperatures and dehydration at Quail Creek State Park in Utah on Sunday, with temperatures reaching 106°F. Despite rescue efforts, she was found unresponsive and pronounced dead. This year’s heatwave has claimed multiple hiker lives in the Southwest, including recent fatalities in Grand Canyon, Death Valley, Snow Canyon, and Canyonlands National Parks.
summary: A 56-year-old woman died from high temperatures and dehydration at Quail Creek State Park in Utah on Sunday, with temperatures reaching 106°F. Despite rescue efforts, she was found unresponsive and pronounced dead. This year’s heatwave has claimed multiple hiker lives in the Southwest, including recent fatalities in Grand Canyon, Death Valley, Snow Canyon, and Canyonlands National Parks.

title: US presidential candidate Kamala Harris is stepmother of two: Know her family
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris has entered the 2024 presidential race following President Joe Biden's exit. As the first stepmother to become vice president, Harris is deeply involved in the lives of her stepchildren, Cole and Ella Emhoff, whom she describes as her "endless source of love and pure joy." Harris married Doug Emhoff in 2014.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris has entered the 2024 presidential race following President Joe Biden's exit. As the first stepmother to become vice president, Harris is deeply involved in the lives of her stepchildren, Cole and Ella Emhoff, whom she describes as her "endless source of love and pure joy." Harris married Doug Emhoff in 2014.
